title: UK Athletics head Neil Black to leave over handling of Alberto Salazar scandal
text:
The head of UK Athletics, Neil Black, has announced he will leave his position at the end of the month after taking the flak for the governing body’s chaotic handling of the Alberto Salazar scandal.

Black looked a broken man at the end of the World Championships in Qatar last weekend, when he suggested he would consider whether to leave his role on returning home on Monday.

With pressure on him to step down, that decision did not take long and confirmation of his impending exit was announced on Tuesday afternoon.

“UK Athletics have announced that Neil Black will leave his role as performance director at the end of October,” read a statement.

“Neil will commence a detailed handover with performance staff until his departure and will fulfil his role supporting Mo Farah at this weekend’s Chicago marathon.”

Salazar, who guided Farah to four Olympic and six world titles, was last week banned from athletics for four years after he was found guilty of multiple doping offences. He is appealing the verdict.
